comment.author: 51798797@N00
comment._content:
The US Park Service Soldiers and Sailors database has these possibles:

1 McGrail, James  Union Infantry 29th Regiment, Pennsylvania Infantry
2 McGrail, James  Union Infantry 78th Regiment, Pennsylvania Infantry
3 McGrail, James  Union Infantry 109th Regiment, Pennsylvania Infantry
4 McGrail, James  Union Infantry 16th Regiment, US Infantry (Regular Army)
5 McGrail, James A.  Union Infantry 138th Regiment, Pennsylvania Infantry 

Is that a uniform more likely worn by a Regular than a volunteer?

Brian
Antietam on the Web (http://antietam.aotw.org)

comment.author: 60114613@N03
comment._content: The name is spelled McGreal. The soldier in the photo is: James McGreal Private Company E 8th P. V. I. (3-months unit) Enrolled April 22, 1861 at Scranton Mustered in April 23, 1861 at Harrisburg Age: 23 Occupation: Rope Maker Residence: Archibald, Luzerne County Mustered out with the Company July 29, 1861 Source: PA Archives ARIAS Card Index Alice J. Gayley Pennsylvania in the Civil War www.pa-roots.com/~pacw/
